questions.question: In English mythology, who caused the death of the Lady of Shallot?
questions.description: Sir Lancelot (or Launcelot) du Lac was one of the Knights of the Round Table in the Arthurian legend.

questions.question: In Greek mythology who did Athena turn into a spider?
questions.description: Arachne was a mortal woman and talented weaver who challenged Athena, goddess of wisdom and crafts, and was transformed into a spider. Spiders are called arachnids after Arachne.

questions.question: In Greek mythology, how many heads did Hydra have?
questions.description: In Greek mythology, the Lernaean Hydra (Greek: Λερναῖα Ὕδρα) was an ancient serpent-like water monster with reptilian traits.

questions.question: In Greek mythology, what did Athena turn Arachne into?
questions.description: Sir Lancelot (or Launcelot) du Lac was one of the Knights of the Round Table in the Arthurian legend.

questions.question: In Greek mythology, what animal is associated with Athena?
questions.description: Some authors believe that, in early times, Athena was either an owl herself or a bird goddess in general: In the third Book of the Odyssey, she takes the form of a sea-eagle.

questions.question: In Greek mythology, what did Daedalus construct for Minos?
questions.description: In Greek mythology, the Labyrinth was an elaborate structure designed and built by the legendary artificer Daedalus for King Minos of Crete at Knossos.

questions.question: In Greek mythology, what was Minos the king of?
questions.description: Crete is the largest and most populous of the Greek islands, the fifth-largest island in the Mediterranean Sea, and one of the 13 administrative regions of Greece.
